text: Union County is a county in northern Florida. Union County is also the smallest county in Florida. The county was founded in 1921 after being cut off from Bradford County. In 2020, about 16,000 people lived in Union County. Lake Butler is the county seat of Union County, it is also the largest city in Union County. Since Union County is the smallest county, it covers only 250 square miles. == Other cities == There are only two other cities in Union County other than Lake Butler. The two other cities are: * Raiford * Worthington Springs == References == == Other websites == * Union County website Category:Florida counties Category:1921 establishments in Florida
title: Union County, Florida
